dialogues.text: We'll put them in the trunk, Cathy. He takes the birds from her and goes to the back of the c The CAMERA STAYS on Cathy who gets into the car on the fr seat. Mitch comes around the other side of the car, stops and looks toward the trees.

dialogues.speaker: THE TREES
dialogues.text: covered with waiting birds.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: getting into car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful with that door. Cathy closes the door gently, and almost soundlessly. Mit does the same with his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch, if they hear the car  starting... if they see movement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take it slow until we get to  the main road. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH'S HAND
dialogues.text: turning the key. The motor springs to life.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE CAR
dialogues.text: anticipation on all the faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. (he takes a deep breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: from the outside, as it creeps out of the yard. The bay i still, the road is still, the car makes barely a sound as passes the gate and starts down the road.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROAD AHEAD
dialogues.text: as they begin driving slowly. The wires are down. A small fire is burning in the brush, where the wires made contac The car continues to move. It turns the first bend in the road.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: She gasps quickly.

dialogues.speaker: A GROUP OF HERONS
dialogues.text: standing, waiting silently.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: as the tension begins to starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.  Shhhh.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROAD AHEAD
dialogues.text: as they approach the derelict barge. It is covered with  waiting seagulls.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: seeing them. Her lip begins to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: turning toward the side of the road ahead. FULL SHOT - AN OVERTURNED SCHOOL BUS - MITCH'S P.O.V. covered with waiting birds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch, let's turn back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Shhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: A ROADSIDE HOUSE
dialogues.text: as the car passes. A barricade has been set up on the fro porch, and a man is leaning over it, dead, a shotgun in h hands. The porch is covered with waiting birds. At the bo window, we see a woman and child peering from a gap.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: reacting. FULL SHOT - THE CAR - BIRD'S P.O.V. as it threads its way slowly and cautiously along the win road to town. The birds are sitting on some of the still- standing wires, watching, waiting. FULL SHOT - THE TOWN APPROACH - THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD as the car turns a bend in the road. There are thousands of  birds ahead, on every gutted and smoldering rooftop, on e pole, on every fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: as he stops the car and looks ahead.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: in the middle of the road, stopped. Ahead are the birds.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: frightened, try not to reveal her fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we turn back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't think so. If we get  through town, I think we'll be all  right.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE CAR
dialogues.text: There is a long silence. It is Melanie who has the strong reason for fearing the birds. It is Melanie, her fear gro who makes the decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go ahead, Mitch.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE CAR
dialogues.text: as it begins moving forward again at an excruciatingly sl rate of speed, into the town and the waiting birds.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: as she turns to look out the window on her side.

dialogues.speaker: A LINE OF BIRDS
dialogues.text: as the car moves past them slowly.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA
dialogues.text: closing her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BRINKMEYER'S GENERAL STORE
dialogues.text: through the windshield. The roof and sills are covered wi birds. The window is smashed in, canned goods are strewn over the sidewalk, bolts of cloth run in a riot from the  open door and across the road, dead people are lying in t gutter. But in the hotel, we see some faces behind broken windows.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY, MITCH
dialogues.text: The tension on their faces,

dialogues.speaker: THE STORES OPPOSITE THE TIDES
dialogues.text: as the car approaches them. The windows are all broken, a merchandise is lying on the sidewalk. Birds are everywher waiting.

dialogues.speaker: A DEAD MAN
dialogues.text: lying on the sidewalk, clutching a television set in his  arms.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: strained, looking at the road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROAD AHEAD
dialogues.text: a clear sky, a bird-free stretch,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost as a prayer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. (he rams down on the  accelerator)

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: as Mitch rams the accelerator to the floor and it zooms a in a burst of speed.

dialogues.speaker: THOUSANDS OF BIRDS
dialogues.text: taking wing.

dialogues.speaker: MORE BIRDS
dialogues.text: taking wing.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch!

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: wrenching at the wheel as the car turns a bend.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROAD AHEAD
dialogues.text: through the windshield, as a flock of birds take wing  immediately ahead.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: from the inside, as birds flutter against it.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF OF THE CAR
dialogues.text: from the inside, as a beak slashes it, letting in a thin  line of light.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: wrenching at the wheel again, another bend.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: navigating the sharp bends in the road as birds streak at in straight lines.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA AND MELANIE
dialogues.text: in the back seat as several slashes appear in the roof ov their heads, letting in more light.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: More slashes, more light in scattered beams.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: her fear growing as the scattered light beams bring back memory of the attic room and her flashlight battle with t owl.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF
dialogues.text: more slashes, building, the beak thrusts combining with t incoming beams of light in a weirdly horrifying way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost a prayer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God... dear God... please,  please, what have we done? Please. (and then in anger at  the roof and the  birds)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't they leave us alone? (shrieking it)

dialogues.speaker: LEAVE US ALONE
dialogues.text: MED. SHOT - THE CAR INTERIOR all the passengers, as the r suddenly rips back.

dialogues.speaker: BIRDS
dialogues.text: from inside the car, hovering over it the moment the roof tears back.

dialogues.speaker: MELANIE
dialogues.text: This is too much for her. She screams at sight of the bir and then turns her face into Lydia's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA AND MELANIE
dialogues.text: as Lydia recognizes Melanie's need. She puts her arm arou Melanie's shoulder and gently, soothingly, holds her clos

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: racing along as the birds hover over it.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: his face screwed in anguish, tears rolling down his cheek as he grips the wheel and hits the gas pedal.

dialogues.speaker: THE OPEN CAR
dialogues.text: streaming canvas ribbons behind it. It turns another bend the road.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROAD AHEAD
dialogues.text: It is arrow-straight, no curves.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: in a burst of speed as it hits the straightaway. It begin to outdistance the birds. The gap widens. A flock of bird attacks it from the side of the road, but it speeds into  them and through them. The gap grows wider and wider. The are well ahead of the birds now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing them.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: only a nod, his face streaming tears.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR, (BIRDS' P.O.V.)
dialogues.text: as they fall way behind now, the car moving swiftly into distance.

dialogues.speaker: LYDIA AND MELANIE
dialogues.text: on the back seat. Melanie begins sobbing in a sudden rele of tension. Lydia, in compassion, and tenderly, cradles  Melanie's head on her shoulder. Melanie, her eyes glisten looks ahead through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR INTERIOR
dialogues.text: all their faces visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitch?  Do... do you think they'll  be all right? In the trunk? Can they  breath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with the faintest  smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they'll be all right, honey. There is hope on their faces as the car streaks into the  wind. Not a wild exuberance, but a relaxation of tension. They stare ahead through the windshield, and then they sq their eyes against the sudden sunrise ahead, and Mitch re up to turn down the sun visor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks... it looks clear up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: moving AWAY FROM THE CAMERA FAST into magnificent sunrise over the crest of the hills. Further and further into the distance it goes.
